title: With Byrne: Pandemic, Decadence, Woodstock, the American Cargo Cult of Fun
description:
Byrne runs The Anadromist Channel and Georgian Crossroads Channel. Byrne and I have had a number of conversations over the last couple of years. He's a wealth of wisdom and cultural knowledge and perspective. Links and notes below

The Anadromist https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIAtCuzdvgNJvSYILnHtdWA
Georgian Crossroads https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeFJ6Tm71ieNcjcUb-Trc8g

the Joker Conversation https://youtu.be/ELo279fyc3Y
Ellul https://youtu.be/ovrd-oFs6bQ
Francis Schaeffer https://youtu.be/41YmCugxGKI

Georgian Crossroads page: Pandemic Easter

Georgian orthodox church

Georgians hate anything that reminds them of communism

 Georgian pandemic

Georgian gov’t said things would be bad...

“Bad” doesn’t really man anything to us

Joker movie

Billie Eilish

Marvel Universe ends 

Julie Nolky past self from 4 months into 2020 https://youtu.be/Ms7capx4Cb8

JBP disappears in 2019

Culture war changes very radically in the last few months

Bob Dylan, times they are a changing, don’t speak too soon because the w

Lenoard Cohen, things are going to slide slide in all directions

We’re officially in the 21st century

First truly global conscious event

We’ve become insect like in the use of technology

At one moment we feel this around the world, at the other moment we see fracture lines develop

Hard borders coming back

Alaska

Woodstock, the last flag waving of the counterculture

Landing on the moon

Message of Love, Movie, Isle of Whyte festival 1970

All of that stuff was hidden from the public

Woodstock was a muddy mess…

Charles Manson, Satanic bible was reliease, altamont rock festival

The psychedelic dream

Our good natures will naturally take over

Tom wolfe, the electric koolaid acid test

Where are the adults here? If everyone is acting like children..

How we got here series

Being a child is the standard adult…

People don’t know how to mature. 

Pascal, the thought about distraction, in Pensees

Now the clown can’t distract you anymore

Juvenilzation, adoltescence, emerging adulthood

Geeks and fans

Math geek, film geek

Geek comes from carnival performers, often alcoholics, a created freak, 

Monster Midway, Lindsay Greshem, Joy Davidson’s first husband, Nightmare Alley from Carny lingo into the popular culture

Swallowing forbidden things. 

Ingesting anything related to your obsession, 

Veggie tales as “as long as it communicates the message”, but does it? 

Cute, big-eyed things don’t predate before Mickey Mouse

Before then you didn’t find these big eyed cute things…

The perfect way to smuggle messages

Be true to yourself from Shakespeare, was full of himself and a liar

Head canon, “in my head canon I see spiderman being like this” 

Leonard Bernstein on TV teaching people about Bach or Beethoven

The great illusion is that it isn’t their bubble at all

When everyone’s a child and no one’s an adult, it means that the adults can do what they want

IDW

You don’t have to work for them

Divide and conquer

You needed your slave and serfs to be adults

JBP was getting people to watch 2.5 lectures on the bible and go through the whole series, speaks of a deep hunger

Maybe we’ve crossed something…

Kidulting

Meaning, if things don’t mean anything. Why read more if what you’re reading doesn’t produce meaning. 

The machine learns how to market and package these things back to you. You have the imitation of meaning. There’s a real cult-like quality to pop culture. But unlike the cults of the 70s with a devious but charismatic leader. Our cults tend to not have leaders. 

Today’s pop cults are much more like Cargo-cults. 

They’ve tapped into the ancestors. How do we reproduce this. 

Fandom has this aspect of the cargo cult. How do we get back the feeling of the Lord of the Rings, 

They bear a resemblance to real meaning what the islanders bear to flight strips and 

These are illusions of meaning. Not the real thing. 

Defects in human created realities. 

Superstition is rife. 

Don’t know how to take life seriously, so instead they take it ironically

Philosophical post-modernism, vs. cultural post-modernism

Anadromist channels

Hans Rookmaker, 

Beauty and horror films, symbolism and horror films
